result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Sarah E Anderson with Attorney Joshua D Christianson appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.  Hanna Neuberg - Clerk 11:21 am
Christianson - matter is resolved includes 4 Branch 2 files - 16CM121, 16CT19, 16CM112, 16CT95
Christianson - deft will plead to Ct 1 in 16CT19 & Ct 1 in 16CM316 - all other counts and files will be dismissed - 1 year probation - $40 restitution - no conditional jail time - requesting to leave open the right to transfer probation to another State 
State - 14 days credit in 16CM316 - requesting 16CM284 be read in and dismissed for restitution
DE - 16CT19 - Ct 1 - pleas no contest - 16CM316 - Ct 1 - pleas no contest

Christianson - requesting court to adopt recommendations

w/held sentence on each count -  1 year probation  concurrent

**60 dtp or pp**

May transfer probation to another State subject to that other State accepting probation 

DISMISS - Ct 2,3,4,5 in 16CM316 w/ prej. Ct 2,3 in 16CT19 w/prej. - read in and dismiss 16CM284 - 16CM121 - 16CM112 - 16CT95
